sourcesContent: import React, { useState } from "react"; import { makeStyles, Card, CardContent, Grid, Typography, Avatar, } from "@material-ui/core"; import acousticness from "../icon/acousticness.png"; import danceability from "../icon/danceability.png"; import instrumental from "../icon/instrumental.png"; import loudness2 from "../icon/loudness2.png"; import popularity from "../icon/popularity.png"; import tempo from "../icon/tempo.png"; import valence from "../icon/valence.png"; import liveness from "../icon/liveness.png"; import speechiness from "../icon/speechiness.png"; import energy from "../icon/energy.png"; const useStyles = makeStyles((theme) => ({ gridContainer: { padding: 10, spacing: 10, alignItems: "center", direction: "row", }, gridItem: { backgroundColor: "#FFB4A2", background: "#000", color: "#000", }, nav_title: { padding: 10, display: "flex", flexDirection: "row", placeItems: "left", fontSize: "1.5rem", fontFamily: "Kiwi Maru", }, step_root: { // align: "center", padding: 10, maxWidth: 1000, marginBottom: 50, backgroundColor: "#ddbea9", borderRadius: 10, }, step_header: { color: "black", textAlign: "left", fontSize: "1.55em", marginBottom: 10, fontWeight: "600", }, step_desc: { color: "black", textAlign: "left", fontSize: "1.1em", marginBottom: 20, }, card: { // backgroundColor: "FFB4A2", }, card_content: { // backgroundColor: "#FFB4A2", }, track_attribute_card_1: { width: "275px", height: "400px", marginBottom: 30, borderRadius: 10, }, track_attribute_font_title: { color: "#000", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 700, fontSize: "1.5em", }, track_attribute_font_title_2: { color: "#fff", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 700, fontSize: "1.5em", }, track_attribute_font_type: { color: "#000", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 600, fontSize: "1.3em", }, track_attribute_font_type_2: { color: "#fff", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 600, fontSize: "1.3em", }, track_attribute_font_content: { marginTop: -10, paddingLeft: 5, paddingRight: 5, color: "#18181F", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 600, fontSize: "1.05em", textAlign: "center", }, track_attribute_font_content_2: { marginTop: -10, paddingLeft: 5, paddingRight: 5, color: "#fff", fontFamily: "Arvo", // fontWeight: 600, fontSize: "1.05em", textAlign: "center", // lineSpacing: "10", }, track_attribute_image: { margin: 10, width: theme.spacing(9), height: theme.spacing(9), }, book: { maxWidth: 925, // height: "250px", // marginBottom: 30, borderRadius: 10, backgroundColor: "#ffe8d6", boxShadow: "2px 2px 7px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4)", }, book_title: { color: "#2b2d42", // fontFamily: "Sawarabi Mincho", fontFamily: "Arvo", paddingTop: 10, paddingBottom: 5, // fontWeight: 1000, fontSize: "2.4em", textAlign: "center", }, })); export default function BookOfTrackAttributes() { const classes = useStyles(); return ( Book of Track Attributes ðŸ“– acousticness type: context tracks with higher acousticness indicate tracks with{" "} more featurings of guitars, pianos, drumsets, etc. whereas, lower acousticness indicate tracks with more featurings of electronic or synthesized elements. danceability type: mood an overall measurement of a track's suitability for dancing based on musical elements including tempo, rhythm, beat strength, and more. energy type: mood an overall measurement of a track's intensity & activity.{" "} higher energy will restrict results to fast, loud, and noisy songs. psst: heavy metal = higher energy & mozart = lower energy instrumentalness type: properties predicts whether a track contains vocals. rap songs are more vocal, whereas lofi study music are less vocal. the higher the value, the more likely the track contains NO vocal content. liveness type: context liveness detects the presence of an audience in the recording.{" "} higher liveness will lead you to more tracks that were probably performed live. increase this value if you want to find tracks that are maybe from an artist's concert. loudness type: properties loudness represents an overall measurement of the decibels (dB) throughout a track. setting a higher loudness will lead you to songs that are more fun to blast on the speakers! popularity type: other popularity provides a measure of - well - how popular you want the tracks in your results to be. set it lower if you want to discover more low-key songs, and set it higher if you want to continue jamming out to tracks just as popular as Despacito or Gangnam Style. speechiness type: properties kind of similar to instrumental, but inverse. setting speechiness to a higher value will lead you to songs that have a higher amount of spoken words. psst: setting this high will get you songs like Rap God by Eminem. tempo type: mood tempo means beats per minute! setting a tempo range = beats per minute range. setting minimum tempo to 140 restricts results to only those tracks with a tempo of greater than 140 bpm. valence type: mood valence will control how happy a song sounds! tracks with higher valence sounds more happy & positive. tracks with lower valence sounds more negative (sad, angry, etc.) ); }
